TopicTitle: Ultimate Challenge: Build a Glider or Plane that can fly around Kerbin

Articles.Content:
OK boys and girls, I got a new challenge for ya that will pull your hair.

Rules:

1. MUST be stock parts only. You can have mods intalled but must not affect the craft stucture or capabilities.

2. Must NOT use any outside force to get it into the air.

3. Must be able to glide or fly all the way around Kerbin if needed. You do not have to prove you did it. Just show me that you can build and fly a plane that would be able to do it.

4. Must not go into space. No rockets allowed other than getting craft into the air.

5. No cheating with any editors or anything that is not in spirit of the competition.

Bunus:

1. Build it so you drive it like a car.

2. Able to climb 20 degree slopes.

3. Vehicle is complete from takeoff to landing (no parts discarded).

Now, once again, I would not ask of you anything I could not do myself so..

Here's mine.

Enjoy the challenge.

Well, if it's range you want, how about infinite range?

This is what I call the Mach 5 Glider. Because it glides (there are no engines on there, and never were), and has a top speed of ~1730 m/s.

Unfortunately if you try and go that fast, you'll almost certainly be kicked well out into space (after that my apoapsis was 191km), but with some discipline and patience you can easily circumvent Kerbin as much as you want.

It's powered by a PB-NUK, so it can keep going forever even in total darkness. To thrust, all you need to do is quickly move the flaps up and down. The quicker you do so, the faster you go.
Infiniglide ftw, also you would need a ton of delta-v to glide around Kerbin without any thrust after launch. Proof or it didn't happen OP.

Dare I suggest that Kerbin circumnavigation challenges are anything but a `new` challenge, although it may remain true that they result in the pulling out of hair.

and without outlawing infinglide bug exploitation, anyone can glide.. well infinitely

And without it, anyone can glide, well, nowhere.

Might I suggest a modification to the contest? First, ban infiniglide (you'll basically need to use the honor system, since even a seemingly normally-designed ship can pull it off), and second, score based on fuel used for a full circumnavigation. The less fuel, the higher the score. That way you encourage gliders, but allow propulsion enough to actually do the job.
